mentions.candidate: Roger Gale and his wife Suzy live locally at their family home with their assortment of dogs and cats.

leaflet.personalStatement: Roger Gale - Working tirelessly for you...

politicalExperience.achievements: Roger was first elected as the Member of Parliament to represent Margate, Herne Bay and the Villages in 1983. He has served as Parliamentary Private Secretary to two Ministers of State, on the Home Affairs Select Committee, as Chairman of the All-Party Animal Welfare Group and as a Vice-Chairman of the Conservative Party.

politicalExperience.role: senior member of the Speakers' Panel of Chairmen
politicalExperience.achievements: Roger is a senior member of the Speakers' Panel of Chairmen and a member of the House of Commons Select Committee.

He is President of Conservative Animal Welfare and holds office within a number of local and national charities including the chairmanship of the TryAngle Awards Foundation. He is Fellow of the Industry and Parliament Trust and a Co-Founder of the Parliament and Armed Forces Scheme and has carried out duties as a warrant-holding Special Constable with the British Transport Police.

images.caption: Roger Gale and his wife Suzy live locally at their family home with their assortment of dogs and cats.
